Black's plan is to crash through on the f- and g-files before White gets any breathing-room.  
We now have queen, knight, rook and bishop all eyeing the weakened kingside, and the only real defender is the white bishop – which has no safe diagonal once the f-pawn is kicked.  
I therefore punch the f-pawn up to f4, creating a beautiful wedge and forcing issues:

[f7f4]
